msContents.summary:
In 1661, the library of the Cistercian abbey of St. Urban near Lucerne was catalogued. The 18th chapter of the library catalogue, simply called „Bibliotheca S. Urbani“, today in Lucerne Central and University Library (CH-Lz, Pp Msc 11), lists the music items. This was quite exceptional at the time, as usually music was preserved in the organ loft in the church. The catalogue comprises a detailed list, alphabetically arranged after the composer’s first names (p. 611-645), and a short alphabetical index of the composers’ surnames (p. 779-786).
This music inventory is among the oldest preserved in Switzerland. The entries go into considerable detail, permitting in most cases the identification of the print. The unknown compiler lists the title, the existing parts, the format, and lastly the place and date of the print. Composers and printers from Switzerland, Germany and Italy are represented in approximately equal proportions.
